official-title.#text:
To amend title 10, United States Code, to establish a direct employment pilot program for members
			 of the National Guard and Reserve, to be known as the

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Work for Warriors Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Direct employment pilot program for members of the National Guard and Reserve

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended to read as follows:
shall carry out a pilot program (to be known as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to provide job placement assistance and
			 related employment services directly to members of the reserve components
			 of the armed forces.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Defense

quote.#tail: ) to enhance the efforts of the

text.#text:
The Work for Warriors Program shall be offered to, and administered by, the adjutants general
			 appointed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chief of the National Guard
			 Bureau

text.#text:
As a condition on the provision of funds under this section to a State to support the operation of
			 a Work for Warriors Program in the State, the State must agree to
			 contribute an amount, derived from non-Federal sources, equal to at least
			 30 percent of the funds provided by the

The Work for Warriors Program should follow a job placement program model that focuses on working
			 one-on-one with a member of a reserve component to cost-effectively
			 provide job placement services, including services such as identifying
			 unemployed and underemployed members, job matching services, resume
			 editing, interview preparation, and post-employment follow up. Development
			 of the Work for Warriors Program should be informed by State direct
			 employment programs for members of the reserve components of the armed
			 forces, such as the programs conducted in California and South Carolina.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may provide technical assistance to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Labor

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and State adjutants general in the development and implementation of the
			 Work for Warriors Program.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop outcome measurements to evaluate the success
			 of the Work for Warriors Program in a State.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau
subsection (a)

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall submit to the
			 congressional defense committees a report describing the results of the
			 program. The Chief shall prepare the report in coordination with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau

Under
			 Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Under Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the completion of a Work for Warriors Program conducted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: paragraph (1)

text.#text:
A description and assessment of the effectiveness and achievements of the Work for Warriors
			 Program, including the number of members of the reserve components hired
			 and the cost-per-placement of participating members.

An assessment of the impact of the Work for Warriors Program and increased reserve component
			 employment levels on the readiness of members of the reserve components.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Department of
			 Defense

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to provide unemployment and
			 underemployment support to members of the reserve components.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Veterans Affairs

text.#text: A comparison of the Work for Warriors Program to other programs conducted by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau

Under
			 Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Under Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness

text.#text: Any other matters considered appropriate by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to carry out the Work for
			 Warriors Program for any fiscal year may not exceed $20,000,000.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau

text.#text: The total amount obligated by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to carry out the Work for Warriors Program
			 applies during fiscal years 2015 through 2018.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau
paragraph (1)

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may extend the Work for Warriors Program for not more than two additional
			 fiscal years.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau
